text: Happy caucus day from Team Hick! We're ready to take on Cory Gardner and bring much-needed change to Washington‚Äîand that starts with getting on the ballot. At a time when Washington is rife with division, John is the independent problem solver we need in the Senate. Climate change is the greatest threat of our time. John has a plan to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, bring harmful climate emissions under control, and lead the world on this issue. Read more: https://medium.com/@hickenlooper/john-hickenloopers-plan-to-combat-climate-change-and-build-a-100-clean-economy-2ab33a66366a  Health care is a right, not a privilege. We need to cut costs, get to universal coverage by bringing a public option to the health insurance marketplace, and stop Republicans from gutting protections for preexisting conditions. We must end the stranglehold the special interests have on Washington. John is not taking a dime of corporate PAC money and will work to overturn Citizens United and shine a light on secret political spending in our elections. The gun violence epidemic in America must end. We need to pass common sense background checks on gun purchases, close the terrorist loophole, and keep guns out of the hands of convicted criminals, such as domestic abusers.  Caucuses start at 2:00pm TODAY! But we advise you get there a bit early. Find your location at https://www.coloradodems.org/2020-caucus-locations

Senator Jessie Danielson has championed issues for working families and has been a leader in the fight to ensure equal pay for equal work. Proud to have Jessie on Team Hick. Remember to caucus today at 2:00! coloradodems.org/caucus

It's caucus day, Colorado! If you're a registered Democrat in CO, you can caucus TODAY at 2pm and help us get on the primary ballot!  We're building a movement to win this Senate seat and bring change to Washington. Join us. Find your caucus location ‚û°Ô∏è

Caucus day is TOMORROW at 2pm (but get there a bit early!) To find your caucus location: 1. Find your voter registration at govotecolorado.com 2. Find your precinct number under "County & District Information" 3. Look up your precinct number at coloradodems.org/2020-caucus-locations/ See you tomorrow!

On Monday, Gabby Giffords is coming to Aurora to discuss how we can end gun violence. With help from Congresswoman Giffords, we took on the NRA in Colorado and passed gun safety legislation. Now it's time to take that fight to the U.S. Senate. Join us:

Chipeta was a respected leader and negotiator. She and her husband helped create the first treaty of Conejos, Colorado. The U.S. government forced the Utes out of Colorado in 1880. In 1985, Chipeta was inducted into the Colorado Women's Hall of Fame. #WomensHistoryMonth

Outdoor recreation generates hundreds of thousands of jobs and billions of dollars for our state. The outdoors are essential to Colorado's identity. It's our responsibility to protect them.
Proud to stand with our unions and our union members like Renee.

Affordable and accessible health care is more important than ever. We have to expand access to health care‚Äînot rip it away.

Steve Farber worked tirelessly for Colorado and cared deeply about our state. I'll always be grateful for the guidance he gave me. He was the best sounding board a person could have. Our hearts are with his family and friends. We'll miss him.

Reproductive freedom is at risk thanks to Republicans packing our courts with anti-choice judges. This could mean the beginning of an end to Roe v. Wade. I‚Äôll keep fighting to protect the right to choose & stand up to anyone who wants to take us backwards.‚Ä¨
Health care is on the ballot.

Thank you Representative Julie McCluskie‚Äîproud to have your support! I look forward to partnering with you to make progress for high country and the rest of our state.

Under the Affordable Care Act: ‚Äî400,000 Coloradans gained health insurance under Medicaid expansion ‚ÄîNearly 95% of Coloradans have health care coverage We can't let Republicans dismantle our progress by overturning the Affordable Care Act.

This is a powerful piece. In the two decades since the massacre at Columbine High School, too many politicians in Washington have refused to stand up to the NRA to pass the gun safety legislation we desperately need. Thank you Coni Sanders for your bravery.

Washington Republicans are jeopardizing our health & safety with this latest attempt to overturn the ACA. Hundreds of thousands of Coloradans could lose health care coverage if this lawsuit succeeds. These political games are putting lives at risk. We need change in Washington.

‚Ä™March is #WomensHistoryMonth! Our state and our nation were built by inspiring, hardworking women. I'm proud to celebrate the leaders and trailblazers who have fought for equality‚Äîand I'm with you all the way as we continue this fight.‚Ä¨

Colorado's rural communities are vital to the success and character of our state. I'm proud to see the progress we've made in bringing broadband to underserved areas. We've still got work to do‚Äîbut Colorado is leading the way.

Colorado is poised to become the fourth state to ban hair discrimination! Thank you Sen. Rhonda Fields, Rep. Janet Buckner, and Rep. Leslie Herod for your hard work and advocacy to pass the CROWN Act.

My friend Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand and I had a great discussion with local leaders and advocates about how we can build a 21st century economy that works for working families. Thank you for joining us, and for your leadership on these issues, Senator!
Welcome to Colorado, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand! I‚Äôm so honored to have your support. Looking forward to working together in the Senate to get things done.
Had the pleasure of meeting Kelsey at Hops & Pie in Denver today. Honored to have you on Team Hick!

Colorado is the center of outdoor recreation in our country‚Äîand it's important that we protect and preserve our outdoors. I had a wonderful visit to Leadville last week to discuss my new COnservation plan!

While we've made progress in Colorado to pass universal background checks and magazine limits, we need action on the national level to end this crisis of gun violence.

One year ago, the House passed the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. Mitch McConnell won't even bring it to the Senate floor for a vote. 36,000 Americans are killed by guns each year. And tragedies like yesterday's in Wisconsin are more and more common.  The gridlock must end.

Big news! I'm honored to have the endorsement of Giffords and to welcome Gabby Giffords to Colorado March 9! Join us for a rally and panel discussion in Aurora on how we can end the gun violence epidemic. Register today: https://www.mobilize.us/hickenlooperforcolorado/event/251971/?utm_source=soc

Thank you Caroline for your continued support! This is the most important election of our lifetimes, and it's going to take all of us working together to win this thing and make Washington work for all of us.
Great to join community advocates to discuss how our health care system can better serve immigrants and refugees.

We expanded access to reproductive health care in CO‚Äîand saw amazing results. Today's anti-choice votes are Washington Republicans' latest efforts to threaten our progress. I am committed to fighting attempts to strip patients of their choices, dignity & power.
Cory Gardner just voted to attack Coloradans' reproductive freedom ‚Äî and even criminalize doctors. Politicians need to stay out of these personal health care decisions.

It's been months since the House passed legislation to tackle prescription drug costs‚Äîbut Mitch McConnell won't even bring it to a vote. We need to do better. Washington is broken, and lives are at stake.

Millions of people visited Colorado's national parks last year!  From Rocky Mountain National Park to the Great Sand Dunes to Mesa Verde to the Black Canyon of the Gunnison, our public lands are an essential part of who we are‚Äîand we must protect them.
We're proud to have extraordinary athletes like Mikaela Shiffrin who call our state home!
Thanks for being on Team Hick, Mark! I'm ready to get to the Senate to make Washington work for our state.
ICYMI: We submitted our petition signatures to qualify for the ballot last week! This is a huge step for our campaign, but our movement to bring change to Washington is just getting started.

When I was Governor, we insured nearly 95% of Coloradans and expanded Medicaid coverage to 400,000+ people. Our work isn't done. I'm running to get Washington back on track to lower prescription drug prices and get folks the quality, affordable care they need.

As the first licensed African American female doctor in Denver, Dr. Justina Ford estimated she delivered nearly 7,000 babies in her 50 year career. Be sure to see the new mural dedicated to her in Five Points. #BlackHistoryMonth
Climate change is an existential threat‚Äîand Colorado is on the frontlines. There's no more time to wait. We need to fight back now. Here's my plan >>
Powerful new podcast from Vic Vela on addiction and recovery. I admire the bravery it takes to tell these stories. Give it a listen.
I'm honored to have former Mayor of Breckenridge John Warner's support in this race!
I sat down with Latinas in the Denver community to talk about some of the issues affecting Colorado and ways we can work together to mobilize every Coloradan to vote this November.
As Coloradans, public lands and the outdoors are a part of who we are. It was my pleasure to discuss my COnservation plan to protect our outdoors in Frisco!
Thanks for the kind words Roslyn! It's going to take all of us working together to win this election!

It's been an incredible couple weeks for our campaign: ‚ÄîSubmitting thousands of petition signatures to get on the ballot ‚ÄîEndorsements from Senator Leroy Garcia, Pipefitters Local 208, Southwest Regional Council of Carpenters, & NARAL Pro-Choice America ‚ÄîTraining nearly 200 volunteers And we're just getting started!

Preserving Colorado's outdoor heritage and stopping Washington's attacks on public lands will be some of my top priorities in the Senate. I was glad to discuss these issues with leaders and business owners in Frisco.

Thank you Pipefitters Local 208! I will stand with unions & support their right to organize, protect their health care, and develop our workforce with a laser focus on training young people and people transitioning into green jobs.

Today, we turned in thousands of signatures to get on the ballot. We deserve a Senator who can bring people together and get things done. That's why I'm running. Colorado is ready for change. And this is just the beginning.
Thank you to the nearly 200 people who came out for our volunteer training last night! It's because of the strength of this grassroots team that we're going to win in November.

A look back in CO history 75 years ago today: WWII soldiers trained at Camp Hale to fight in the Alps‚Äîand returned home to start our ski industry. Passing the #COREact would honor these veterans by designating Camp Hale as a National Historic Landscape.

Hands-on skills training opportunities, like what the ski operations program at Colorado Mountain College offers, are crucial to the success of our outdoor rec economy. I'll support job training programs like these and apprenticeships in the Senate. Thanks for the tour!
Honored to have the endorsement of my friend Senate President Leroy Garcia! Thrilled to have him on my team as we campaign across the state to change Washington.

Talking to folks over breakfast this morning in Leadville about how Washington isn‚Äôt doing enough to lower health care costs‚Äîand our mountain communities are paying the price. We need to do better.

Grateful to have stopped by the Martin Luther King Jr. and Emmett Till statue in Pueblo this weekend. Thank you to our guides Ray and Dr. Ruth for reminding us of Dr. King's legacy of equality and justice.

It's a beautiful snowy day here in Frisco! Had a great discussion at EVO3 Workspace about how crucial our outdoor industry is‚Äînot just in Colorado, but across the nation. Great discussion this morning in Frisco with leaders in our outdoor industry! We need to keep our public lands public and make sure that more folks have access to the outdoors we love. Read my plan: https://medium.com/@hickenlooper/john-hickenloopers-plan-to-protect-our-outdoors-79439142cbe8
Thank you to everyone who joined us in Frisco at the Outer Range Brewing Co. yurt! In Colorado, we know how to work together and get things done. I‚Äôm ready to bring that spirit to Washington.

Over 4.6 million people visited Rocky Mountain National Park last year! I'm thrilled to see so many folks enjoying our great outdoors. This is exactly why we need an aggressive plan to preserve & protect the #publiclands we love.

Colorado's economy‚Äîespecially in rural and mountain communities‚Äîrelies on our outdoors. It's exciting to see Colorado Mesa University investing in this crucial industry by preparing the next generation of leaders!

Everyone around the table yesterday in Pueblo had a story about how Washington isn't working for them. We need to make it easier to access capital. We need more skills training programs. And we need more affordable health care coverage.

‚Ä™Packed house today in Colorado Springs!‚Ä¨ ‚Ä™Thank you to everyone who joined us at Phantom Canyon Brewing Company. It‚Äôs going to take all of us working together to win this, and I‚Äôm more fired up than ever to get Washington working for Coloradans.‚Ä¨
We're organizing in all 64 counties across Colorado to win in November. Thanks to all who came out to our meet and greet at Squawk Coffee in Pueblo today!
Great to meet with the Pueblo Latino Chamber of Commerce today to talk about how we can make Washington work better for our minority-owned small businesses.

In Colorado, we expanded access to reproductive health care‚Äîand saw incredible results. While states across the country are attacking reproductive rights, it's more important than ever we have leaders who will fight these attacks. I'm proud to have NARAL Pro-Choice America's endorsement.

Barney L. Ford was a notable civil rights advocate in Colorado who effectively delayed Colorado statehood because the proposed constitution didn't allow black people to vote. After fighting for the 15th Amendment in DC, he helped make Colorado the 38th state. #BlackHistoryMonth

I will always support working families, protect workers' right to organize, and work to expand certified apprenticeship programs. Proud to have the Southwest Regional Council of Carpenters endorsement in this race. Together, we‚Äôll win this thing.

Climate change is the defining threat of our time, and we need an aggressive plan to fight back and conserve our environment and public lands. Happy Valentine's Day to the best state.

It's been two years since 17 students & faculty members were killed in Parkland. We have yet to see meaningful gun safety reform to prevent another tragedy. Inaction is costing us lives. If Washington lawmakers won't do something, it's time to replace them with people who will.

Today, I heard from patients, providers, and advocates about the Black maternal health crisis in our country. Black women are 3-4x more likely to die from pregnancy complications than white women. It's reprehensible. In the Senate, I'll fight racial bias in health care.

Couldn‚Äôt be prouder to earn the endorsement of the Southwest Regional Council of Carpenters! We need to get Washington working again and invest in our infrastructure so carpenters can do what they do best: build!  I look forward to continuing to fight alongside them on behalf of working families.

I'm honored to have the endorsement of NARAL Pro-Choice America! Reproductive rights are under attack in states across the country, but here in Colorado we expanded access to reproductive health care. I will continue that fight in the U.S. Senate.

Coloradans know we need to take action to stop the rising costs of prescription drugs. But we can't do it alone. It's time for Washington to stop caving to special interests and to get things done‚Äîlives depend on it.

The Trump Administration is attacking crucial environmental protections. Again. It's unacceptable. It's more important than ever that we have leadership in Washington that will stand up for our communities.

Our outdoor economy and Colorado way of life depend on us being good stewards of the environment. I'm fed up with Washington refusing to act. We need a bold plan to protect our outdoors. Here's mine: https://medium.com/@hickenlooper/john-hickenloopers-plan-to-protect-our-outdoors-79439142cbe8

A Colorado native, Dr. Florence Sabin was the first female professor at Johns Hopkins Medical School and the first woman elected to the National Academy of Sciences. Dr. Sabin broke barriers for #WomenInScience, and her legacy will continue to inspire a new generation of scientists.
All across Colorado, we're leading on fighting climate change and transitioning to clean energy. Congratulations to CSU Pueblo on this achievement!

Passing the #COREact is a key part of my outdoors plan. Republican obstruction has stalled this bill‚Äîwe can‚Äôt afford this inaction. Our outdoor economy and Colorado way of life depend on our being good stewards of the environment. We are at a crucial moment for protecting our land, water & air‚Äîso much of what makes Colorado special.  Washington needs a bold plan to promote our outdoor economy while conserving our natural spaces. Here‚Äôs mine >>

Washington is bulldozing through our national monuments, carving up our public lands, and auctioning them off to the highest bidder. As a Coloradan, I am fed up. Today, I released an aggressive plan to protect our outdoors. We must protect what makes Colorado so special.
While the Trump Administration is rolling back emissions standards, Colorado continues to lead the way in getting more electric vehicles on the road.
Nathaniel Rateliff is a treasure. Can't wait to listen to the new album.

Reynelda Muse's award-winning career made history in Colorado. She was the first woman and African-American to anchor a newscast in Colorado. She went on to be a founding anchor on CNN. #BlackHistoryMonth

It was my pleasure to attend the NAACP Denver monthly meeting! Thank you for your time, service, and commitment to social justice.

Thank you to the folks in HD3 for welcoming me to your monthly meeting! Together, we've made Colorado a leader in fighting climate change, expanding health care, and keeping our kids safe from gun violence‚Äîand we're just getting started.
Colorado's outdoors are a central part of our identity. If Cory Gardner won't stand up for our public lands, it's time to replace him with someone who will.
Life is a thrill with you. Love you, John. Happy birthday to my favorite banjo player, brewer, and champion for Colorado! -Robin ü•≥
Discrimination isn‚Äôt the Colorado way ‚Äî at the Bureau of Land Management or anywhere else. Interior needs to reverse this.

Senator Cory Gardner voted to acquit Donald Trump. No matter the issue‚Äîbe it impeachment, health care, or climate change‚Äîhe's shown that he won't stand up to his party. Coloradans deserve a Senator who will put them first. Every time.
Who knows what Donald Trump will say about the state of our union tonight, but one thing is clear: Washington is broken. We need a change. Help us win in November. #SOTU

Rosa Parks was born 107 years ago today. 65 years after the Montgomery Bus Boycott, her legacy lives on‚Äîreminding us to fight for equality and not tolerate injustice. Today we honor and remember Rosa Parks, and the progress that she made possible. #BlackHistoryMonth

Climate change is the greatest threat we face today‚Äîbut Republicans in Washington refuse to act. Instead, they are rolling back crucial protections for our land, air, and water. We need to do better to protect Colorado for generations to come. Here's how:

Thank you JeffCo Dems for all you have done to move our state forward. From knocking doors to making phone calls to casting your ballots, you are all an integral part of the progress we've made. Together, I know we can win this year!

Congratulations to The String Cheese Incident on 25 years together! Colorado is lucky to have you! This week is National Gun Violence Survivors Week. Colorado knows the pain of gun violence too well. This week, we remember the victims and lift up the voices of survivors who bear the tragedy of gun violence every day.
Mi Casa is changing lives in the Denver community by providing access to educational and economic opportunities. It was my pleasure to tour the resource center.
Public lands are a critical part of our way of life‚Äîand Washington needs to listen to Coloradans who refuse to have them sold out to the highest bidder.

I‚Äôll always be a beer guy, but it was a pleasure to be at the Talnua Distillery in Arvada tonight! I'm proud of what we've accomplished in Colorado‚Äîfrom expanding Medicaid to passing background checks to protecting our public lands. I'm ready to get Washington back on track.
A stunning Colorado sunset tonight. Hope you saw it! #cowx
Yes, our public lands are a huge part of our culture and economy, but they're essential for craft beverages too! üçª As a fellow brewer and Coloradan, I'm calling on the Senate to pass the #COREact.
Thank you to the black leaders and activists, past and present, who have fought for equality and justice. We celebrate you. We honor you. #BlackHistoryMonth

The Outdoor Retailer Outdoor & Snow Show highlights the strength of our outdoor recreation economy‚Äîan industry with over 229,000 jobs in Colorado. We must come together and continue to be steadfast advocates for outdoor rec and our public lands.

Thank you One Colorado for naming me a pro-equality champion! We've made tremendous strides for equality‚Äîbut there are still threats to LGBTQ people across the country. I will always stand up for equality and for the LGBTQ community.
Our health care system is leaving too many Americans behind‚Äîeven with insurance, the cost of prescription drugs is often out of reach. We've got to do better.
We need a Senator who works for Colorado, not for Donald Trump. This is about doing what's right for our country.

Eleven years ago, President Obama signed the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, a crucial step in the fight for equality. But there is still work to do to ensure that women‚Äîespecially women of color‚Äîare paid and treated equally in the workplace. In Colorado, we increased transparency around employer pay practices & added protections for pregnant employees. Last year, equal pay legislation was signed into Colorado law! Now, the Senate must act to pass the Paycheck Fairness Act and ensure equal pay for equal work.
The American people deserve to hear from firsthand witnesses. No one who is truly independent could possibly think otherwise. Colorado deserves better.

It's been exactly one year since Senator Michael Bennet and Congressman Joe Neguse introduced the #COREact. The House passed it in October. Now it's stuck in the Senate where Washington Republicans refuse to vote ‚Äî why are they still blocking a Colorado-driven bill to protect our public lands?
Great to meet with supporters in Broomfield this weekend! As your Senator, I‚Äôll work to bring real change in Washington and break through the gridlock that‚Äôs leaving too many Coloradans behind.

Today, 75 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, #WeRemember the millions of victims of the Holocaust and honor the survivors. As we vow #NeverAgain, we need to remain committed to rooting out bigotry and anti-Semitism everywhere.
‚Ä™On this day in 1915, Rocky Mountain National Park was established! Colorado is blessed with incredible outdoor spaces and scenery‚Äîand we must protect and preserve them for future generations.‚Ä¨
In Colorado, we're on the front lines of climate change. We can't afford to wait‚Äîit must be our top priority to fight back.
Happy #LunarNewYear! May the year of the rat bring happiness, health, and good fortune to all.

With the mess right now in Washington, I believe this is a time for people who know how to do things differently. Who know how to get things done. I hope you'll join our campaign‚Äîto find a different way so we can make progress for Colorado and for America.

Lt. Col. Ian McBeth lost his life heroically volunteering to fight the wildfires in Australia. My heart goes out to the family and loved ones of Ian McBeth, the two other victims of the crash, and all affected by the fires.
Climate change is the defining challenge we face today. We need a bold, science-based approach to fight back. Read my plan:

I am humbled to receive the Barack Obama-Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Humanitarian Award from the Colorado Springs Ministerial Alliance. We must further Dr. King‚Äôs legacy by tackling issues like criminal justice reform, education, & health care with a ‚Äòfierce urgency of the now.‚Äô

It was wonderful to join Kerry Donovan for the National Western Stock Show this week! Proud to celebrate Colorado's western traditions and agricultural communities at one of the largest livestock shows & rodeos in the world.

I was honored to speak at the Colorado Black Round Table's Martin Luther King Jr. Youth Leadership Session. Every young person in Colorado deserves access to education and opportunities‚Äîand I'm with you all the way as we build the next generation of leaders.

From voting to repeal the Affordable Care Act to confirming dozens of anti-choice judges, Senate Republicans have made it clear that they are determined to overturn #RoevWade. Now more than ever, we need elected officials who will protect and defend reproductive rights.

When I was Governor, we expanded access to long-acting reversible contraception (LARC) across Colorado. In eight years, unintended pregnancies dropped by 54% among young women. Reproductive rights are fundamental‚Äîand it's time to treat them as such.

Protecting #RoevWade is essential. But we must go further to ensure that everyone has access to the reproductive health care they need. I'm committed to protecting the right of all Coloradans to control their own bodies.

States across the nation are restricting access to abortion, and Republicans in Washington have packed our courts with anti-choice judges. Colorado deserves better. I always have, and always will defend the right to choose.

While states across the nation are restricting reproductive rights, Colorado has done the opposite‚Äîand we've seen incredible results. I've proudly fought for #reprorights for years. Now, the fight is more important than ever, and I won't back down.

On the 47th anniversary of #RoevWade, reproductive rights are under attack. I will fight as hard as I can against anyone in Colorado or in Washington who tries to take away the right to safe, legal abortion.

Yesterday, the Denver #Marade honored Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. with one of the largest marches and rallies in the nation. I was proud to join arms with civil rights leaders from Colorado and across the country who work every day to continue Dr. King's legacy.

10 years ago today, the Citizens United decision opened the door for corporations and special interests to undermine our democracy. We can't let dark money groups and corporate PACs buy Colorado's senate seat. It's time to give power back to the people.

Upholding the rule of law should be a priority for both parties during this impeachment trial. I hope we see that today. But without firsthand witnesses and documents, we won't have a trial‚Äîwe'll have a sham.

As we continue to fight for equality and racial justice in Colorado and across the country, the messages of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. are vital. We must always be committed to carrying on the Dream. Let freedom ring!
‚Ä™Great to sit down with my friend @brothajeff this afternoon. Happy #MLKDay!

Arm in arm, we march to honor Dr. King's legacy as a force for equality, peace, and love. Honored to march with Eldrin Bell at the #MLK Marade, who served Dr. King unto death and guarded his final resting place after his assassination.

Great to hear from people in Castle Rock today about their priorities: affordable health care, solutions to combat climate change, and common sense gun reform. Thanks to those who came out, now let's get it done!

It was my privilege to join my friends at the Denver NAACP for their Freedom Fund Brunch in support of youth programs in our community. For over 110 years, the NAACP has fought for justice and equality, and I am proud to fight alongside you.

From providing educational opportunities to supporting entrepreneurs, the people at Mi Casa do incredible work to help Coloradans succeed. ‚Ä¨Thank you for the tour‚ÄîI know we can make Washington work better for you, and I look forward to seeing what more you accomplish.
It was a pleasure and honor to attend the Martin Luther King, Jr. Business Awards to celebrate leaders and organizations that are continuing Dr. King's legacy.
Proud to march with Moms Demand Action at the Denver Womxn's March! Unity will win over divisiveness. And together we will listen, unite, and act to move our country forward.
‚Ä™It‚Äôs always a pleasure to be back at the Wynkoop. Thanks for sharing your time, your questions, and a beer with me. Now let‚Äôs go win this!‚Ä¨
I had the wonderful opportunity to stop by the Flagler Senior Center and play a little tune last week.

Climate change is the greatest threat we face today‚Äîand it is long past time to do something about it. We can't accept denial and destructive policies from Washington Republicans. We need bold, science-based solutions to fight back.
Incredible news out of Virginia! Congratulations to the activists and lawmakers for this tremendous step forward to ensure equal rights for all Americans, regardless of gender.

Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans have pushed dozens of anti-choice judges onto every level of our courts, making the threat to Roe v. Wade very, very real. We must loudly defend reproductive rights.
There's no one I'd rather be on this adventure with than you. Happy anniversary, Robin. I love you!

Washington isn't going to change unless we change it‚Äîand the Democratic Women of Boulder County are on the front lines of making that change happen. Thank you for hosting these amazing events and letting me be a part of it!
Thank you Fort Morgan for having me! Rural Coloradans face too many challenges accessing affordable, quality health care‚Äîand you deserve a Senator who will fight for you.

I'm glad Colorado's Rep. Jason Crow will present the facts in President Trump's impeachment trial. As a national security expert and former Army Ranger, I know he will take his responsibility to uphold our rule of law very seriously. Now Senate Republicans need to do the same.

I'm humbled to report we raised $2.8 million last quarter. The best part is we did it the right way: ‚ÄîOur average grassroots donation was $26 ‚Äî$0 from corporate PACs ‚ÄîColoradans from all 64 counties chipped in last year (including a few brewers!) Thank you. I'm so proud of this team.

Trump & Washington Republicans continue to put our health and safety at risk by rolling back environmental protections. Climate change is the defining threat of our time‚Äîbut instead of finding solutions, they're taking us backwards.

Colorado is on the front lines of climate change. While we've played a leadership role in the face of the Trump Administration‚Äôs destructive attacks, we must do more. Here's my plan to combat climate change: https://medium.com/@hickenlooper/john-hickenloopers-plan-to-combat-climate-change-and-build-a-100-clean-economy-2ab33a66366a
Very proud of these two Coloradans!

Everywhere we stopped on our Eastern Plains swing, I heard how important it is to Coloradans to improve health care coverage and lower costs. Getting better quality care more efficiently will be a top priority of mine in the Senate.

Happy to be at the Aurora Democratic Breakfast Forum this morning at the Athenian Restaurant talking about how to make what we've accomplished in Colorado a model for the country. Thanks for your questions!
Can‚Äôt pass the I-70 Diner without stopping in for blueberry pie! Glad to see the electric charging stations out front too.

Today in Cheyenne Wells, I heard about the challenges of unreliable broadband for health care. Hospitals shouldn‚Äôt have to tell employees to get off the WiFi when they need to send a CT scan. We've made progress expanding rural broadband in CO, but we need Washington to step up.‚Ä¨
Thank you for the thoughtful questions and conversation last night in Burlington! Be back soon.

This morning at Simkins Parlour in Sterling, I heard about the challenges people in rural communities are facing getting health care. Washington isn‚Äôt doing much to help drive down costs and improve quality. We‚Äôve got to do better.

I believe this is a time for people who know how to do things differently‚Äîwho know how to work together to get things done. That's why I'm running for Senate. Thank you to everyone who came to CooperSmith‚Äôs to talk about how we can work together to move this country forward.
Had a great visit at Wolf Robotics here in Fort Collins. As they told me, talent is their biggest resource, and that‚Äôs clear. Really amazing people doing some really incredible work.
Starting the day off right ‚Äî talking with folks in Greeley about how we can make Washington work better for them. Thanks for having me!
Sen. Lois Court has given so much to Denver and Colorado. She's an incredible legislator and will be missed at the State Capitol. Wishing her a full and quick recovery.

Climate change is the defining challenge of our time, and we are feeling its impacts in Colorado and across the world. We can't accept Washington Republicans' dangerous policies and denial. We need to urgently confront this crisis.

When they play political games with our health care in Washington, it hurts people like Laura and the 800,000 Coloradans with pre-existing medical conditions. We have to vote in 2020 like our lives depend on it because for many, they do.
Colorado's beauty never ceases to amaze! Here are a few destinations to get your 2020 Colorado travel list started.
I am proud to earn the endorsement of the Congressional Hispanic Caucus BOLD PAC. I look forward to working with them in the Senate to prioritize Colorado workers and get Washington working again.
Happy New Year, magnificent Colorado! We have a big and important year ahead. Stay committed, stay hopeful, and keep making your voice heard. We have a lot to look forward to!

Stopped in Edwards and couldn't help myself... We've got udder 12 hours to go until our year-end fundraising deadline! Help us meet our goal! https://secure.actblue.com/donate/hickenlooperforco-soc?refcode=191231_fb1

We need to be making large-scale investments in science to protect our planet and public health. Not doing the complete opposite. We need an Administration that understands that and more scientists in the Senate to hold them accountable.

I'm horrified by the rise of anti-Semitism in our country. My heart breaks for the victims of last night's awful attack in New York. Everyone should be able to worship in peace and without fear. There is no room for hate and bigotry in our country. We won't tolerate it.

In Colorado, we brought folks together to build one of the most innovative health care exchanges in the country. While we still have more to do to get people affordable care, nearly 95% of Coloradans now have coverage. I'm ready to do it again in the Senate. We must end the attacks on our care that cause anxiety for so many Coloradans.

The Pueblo steel mill will be the first in the nation to be powered by renewable energy. We accomplished this by bringing people together to find common ground and get things done. We need more of that spirit in Washington. That's why I'm running for Senate.
Happy Kwanzaa to all those celebrating! May your week be filled with joy and surrounded by people you love. If you're in the Denver area, here's a great list of local Kwanzaa events:
Spending the holidays with family and friends in Colorado is always a gift. Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!
Skye patiently waiting for everyone to wake up. Merry Christmas
A beautiful holiday dinner with two of the most accomplished people I know! It's always so great to see Colorado's 49th Lieutenant Governor Donna Lynne. Merry Christmas Eve!
A beautiful holiday dinner with two of the most accomplished people I know! It's always so great to see Colorado's 49th Lieutenant Governor Donna Lynne. Merry Christmas Eve!

70% of people don't graduate with a college degree & many more need new skills for our new economy. We must expand skills training and certified apprenticeship programs to meet those needs. We did it in Colorado, and in the Senate I'll make sure we're prioritizing working people.
#HappyHanukkah Colorado! Wishing you and yours peace, joy, and light.

With the mess in Washington right now, I believe this is a time for people who know how to do things differently‚Äîwho know how to work together to get things done. That's why I'm running for Senate. I hope you'll join our campaign today at https://secure.actblue.com/donate/hickenlooperforco-soc?refcode=fb_191222

Celebrating the season with my friend Governor Roy Romer. No matter how you celebrate, I hope you're able to connect with the people you love, have some laughs, and pitch in a little to help out those who are less fortunate. Happy Holidays!
Missy Franklin is heading to the Tokyo Olympics next year to raise awareness for protecting our environment and climate change. Missy, you're an inspiration, and Colorado is so proud of you!

I was incredibly honored to meet with the African Chamber of Commerce. Coloradans from 30 different countries participated! I learned about how they're providing skills and job training for African immigrants who are making Colorado home.

Ran into an old friend while doing some last minute holiday shopping. I've known Gretchen since before my days as a brewer! She works at Rockmount Ranch Wear‚Äîwhere the snap button western shirt was invented. If anyone on your list needs an iconic Colorado gift... go to Gretchen!

I had the privilege to meet with the Southwest Regional Council of Carpenters and apprentices today. We must give workers the skills training and certified apprenticeship opportunities they need to earn a decent living in this economy. I'll make that a priority in the Senate.
Cory Gardner, Donald Trump, and the GOP have made clear they will do anything and everything to dismantle the Affordable Care Act and end protections for pre-existing conditions. We can‚Äôt let them.

If the President and Washington Republicans get their way, millions could lose their health care and protections for pre-existing conditions will be stripped. I will fight to expand health care and make it more affordable. Always.
Congratulations to Colorado's Philip Bailey and Earth, Wind & Fire for being honored by the Kennedy Center! They are the first African-American band in history to be awarded the honor.
We‚Äôve made a lot of progress in the last ten years getting Coloradans access to health care. But we still have work to do to remove barriers to care for everyone‚Äîespecially people of color.

Whatever I've accomplished in life, it's been because of the collaboration, encouragement, and generosity of others. This campaign is no different. We're looking for Founding Partners to build this from the ground up. Will you join us?
Tasty beer that's veteran-owned and brewed with mountain views? Sounds great.  Congratulations, Red Leg Brewing Company on your new venture‚Äîcan't wait to visit when construction is done!
This is it, folks: It's the last day to enroll in health insurance to be covered January 1, 2020! Find a plan that works for you at https://connectforhealthco.com/.
It was a distinct privilege to work with Elbra Wedgeworth over the years. She exemplifies what it means to be a true public servant. I'll always carry the lessons she taught me.

7 years ago today, we lost 20 children and 6 faculty in a tragic mass shooting at Sandy Hook. We thought this has to be it‚ÄîWashington has no choice but to act. They still haven't, but we won't give up. We will take action to end gun violence in this country.

Prescription drug prices are crushing Colorado families. Just this week, the House passed a bill aimed to fix this. But like hundreds of other bills, it will likely be held up in Mitch McConnell‚Äôs Senate. We need to get government working for us again.

The Pueblo steel mill has been an essential part of Pueblo's community & economy for well over 100 years. Now, it will be the first-in-the-nation steel mill to be powered by solar energy. Touring it this week gave me fresh appreciation for just how special it is.

Way to go, Colorado Springs! As more projects like this one come online, we will reduce our dependence on fossil fuels and continue to lead the nation in clean energy production, so we can get to net-zero emissions by 2050.
The deadline to enroll in health insurance is just around the corner. Fortunately in Colorado, getting covered is easy. Keep you and your family safe and healthy in 2020 by signing up today!

Ensuring high school students can earn college credit before they graduate is one way we can help set our young people up for success. Colorado is leading the way and we‚Äôll keep working to expand opportunities to every classroom.
Finding creative ways to connect and support businesses is essential to lifting up Pueblo's economy. The Pueblo Latino Chamber of Commerce is doing just that. Thanks for letting me stop by!

Happy #ColoradoGivesDay! Giving back to your favorite non-profits is a great way to do some good during the holidays. Join thousands of Coloradans and find your favorite local non-profit to support below.
Great to talk with the Pueblo County Democrats today! I appreciate all of your hard work to move Pueblo and our state forward.
I‚Äôm glad to see the Human Rights Campaign gave eight of Colorado's communities high equality index scores. I‚Äôm a proud ally and will continue to fight for LGBTQ+ folks in the U.S. Senate.
Need health insurance? The deadline to enroll is coming up on Dec. 15! Make sure you‚Äôre covered and take a look at the plans here ‚û°Ô∏è
So awesome to join my friends for the 6th Annual  to support @takenotecolo and its mission to make sure every K-12 student has access to musical instruments and instruction.

It‚Äôs been 78 years since the attack on Pearl Harbor. The horrors of that day and the war that followed still reverberate today. To all Americans like my mother‚Äôs first husband, Bow, who fought to defend democracy and freedom: Thank you, we‚Äôll never forget your sacrifice.

The 13th Amendment abolishing slavery was ratified 154 years ago today. This was a first step. We still have a long way to go in our country to eliminate institutional racism and ensure equality and justice for all.

We brought Coloradans of all stripes together to accomplish big things. We expanded health care coverage, invested in transit & enacted world-class policies to combat climate change. I want to take this experience of getting things done to Washington.  https://red.msudenver.edu/2019/hickenlooper-touts-record-as-consensus-builder.html

Great to talk with Preet Bharara when he was in Denver. Hope you'll give our conversation a listen!This week's special #StayTuned episode features conversations while on tour this fall with: John W. Hickenlooper, Shannon Watts, Mayor Jacob Frey, Dana Nessel, and Barbara McQuade:  applepodcasts.com/preet

Great photos. Congratulations to the artists inducted into the Colorado Music Hall of Fame. We are so lucky to have such a stellar music scene here in Colorado.Photos: Last night was the first Colorado Music Hall of Fame ceremony hosted at the Mission Ballroom.

This is totally unacceptable. We must reach net-zero emissions by 2050 or sooner, and Washington is refusing to do what it would take to get us there. We need a bold, science-based approach to combat climate change. Here‚Äôs my plan ‚û°Ô∏è https://medium.com/@hickenlooper/john-hickenloopers-plan-to-combat-climate-change-and-build-a-100-clean-economy-2ab33a66366a

Now here‚Äôs a Colorado list that‚Äôll make you hungry! It‚Äôs tough to choose which is the most "Colorado"... But for me, nothing hits the spot after a day on the slopes like a hot bowl of green chile and a cold beer.

Hats off to the good folks of Fairplay for stepping up to lend a hand to hundreds of people stranded in the snow over the weekend. The kindness you showed to strangers in need is what makes me proud to call Colorado home.

I spent my morning with Ed Perlmutter and labor leaders to discuss how we can best support Colorado's working families. We must protect and strengthen collective bargaining rights and expand skills training programs & apprenticeships‚Äîto start!

Asking for money is the worst part of running for office, but we have to do it because there's a lot at stake here. Our November fundraising deadline is tonight at midnight, and I'd be really grateful if you'd chip in. Thanks!
Happy #SmallBusinessSaturday! Hope you can get out and #ShopSmall and #DineSmall today.

155 years ago today, 200 members of the Cheyenne and Arapaho tribes were murdered in the Sand Creek Massacre. We won't run from this history. We will carry the truth forward and continue to work for peace and healing.

From our family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving. I hope you've taken a moment today to tell your loved ones how much they mean to you. I'm so grateful for my family, everyone on Team Hick, and every day in Colorado.

For over a decade, one of my favorite Thanksgiving traditions has been serving a meal at the Denver Rescue Mission. I hope we can all do our part to give back and make the world a little brighter this year.
Sen. Angela Williams has fought fiercely to move Colorado forward. She‚Äôs been a steadfast advocate for small businesses, women, and people of color in our state. I wish her the very best.
A great Colorado tradition continues! All 41 of Colorado's state parks will be free to access on Friday. Thank you to Colorado Parks and Wildlife for making this possible. #FreshAirFriday
Stopped in Idaho Springs on our way to Summit County last week, and who do we see shoveling snow on city sidewalks? The Chief of Police! Thank you for keeping us safe.

Looking forward to rooting for the Grammy-nominated CO musicians. Fun tidbit here: "The physical Grammy Awards, incidentally, are made in Colorado by artist John Billlings, who handcrafts each of the statuettes in his studio on Colorado‚Äôs Western Slope."

Our communities thrive when everyone has the resources to succeed. For the last 25 years, the Family & Intercultural Resource Center has given people in Summit County support when they need it. Grateful for the staff and volunteers who power FIRC. Your work is invaluable.

I've brought people together to solve big issues before: we passed universal background checks & got 94% of Coloradans health insurance. Washington needs more problem solvers who can bring people together. That's why I'm running for Senate.

FedEx lobbied intensely for the Trump tax bill. And guess what? FedEx's taxes were reduced from $1.5 billion to $0! This is messed up and exactly why people are so fed up with Washington. Our leaders should be working to help people, not to make big corporations even richer.
Jake Burton Carpenter was a snowboarding pioneer and had a huge impact on Colorado. Very sad to hear of his passing.

Colorado's indigenous communities have made rich contributions to our state and have taught us so much about the sanctity of place. Your histories, voices, and stories are vitally important. And we will continue to lift them up. #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth
Road closures because the weather is too good...only in Colorado! In all seriousness, please stay safe on the roads whether it's sunny or snowy and take proper precautions. üòé

22 transgender or gender non-conforming people‚Äîalmost all Black women‚Äîhave been killed in the U.S. this year for being who they are. And that number is likely low because murders of transgender people often go unreported. Today, we come together and remember them. #TDOR

We celebrate the remarkable life of extraordinary educator and author Marie Greenwood, who passed away on Friday just shy of her 107th birthday. Marie made history as the first African American tenured teacher in DPS and uplifted and inspired all of us. We'll miss her dearly.
Santa Clarita last week, Fresno last night, Duncan this morning. We do not have to live like this. We need meaningful action to end the gun violence epidemic. Right now.

It's National Take a Hike Day! Looking for a hike? We mapped 39,000 miles of Colorado's stunning trails when I was Governor. Find one below and then grab a friend or two, water, and some trail mix and get outdoors!

We can‚Äôt let the profits of insurance companies come before making sure people have quality health care. Folks in Teller County know that and I'm glad I had the chance to talk with you about it this week.

The best part of running for office is hearing from Coloradans about the future they want to see for our state and our country. Thank you to the Douglas County Democrats for sharing your vision with me.

No trip to Colorado Springs is complete without a stop at Phantom Canyon Brewing Company. Back in the day, we helped save the historic building from demolition by bringing together local businesspeople, and they‚Äôve been serving up great beers and food since.

My heart goes out to the students, teachers, first responders, parents, and community in Santa Clarita. Here in Colorado, we know all too well the pain you are feeling. We cannot let history continue to repeat itself‚Äîwe need meaningful action to end gun violence now.
It was a privilege to have lunch with veterans in El Paso County today. Thank you for your service to our country. I will always have your back in the U.S. Senate.

We kicked off our "Expanding COverage and Lowering COsts" tour in Colorado Springs today with the Peak Vista Community Health Centers team. It was great to hear from patients, providers, and policy experts about the challenges (and creative solutions!) to providing quality care.

I'm so glad I was able to join my friends at NARAL Pro-Choice Colorado last night for an Allies of Reproductive Rights event. Your work is so important. Everyone should have the right to reproductive freedom, and I'm proud to stand and fight for the right to choose.

The Supreme Court heard arguments today in the president's case to strip 800,000 #DACA recipients of their ability to stay in the United States. We must take action now and provide a pathway to citizenship for Dreamers. #HomeIsHere

Limiting the role of science in the EPA's decision-making process will do serious harm to public health & our environment. I hope that Senator Cory Gardner, the Chair of the Science Subcommittee, will speak out loudly‚Äîand soon‚Äîagainst this dangerous development.
The U.S. Marine Corps created the first dog platoon in WW II. Homer of Longmont helped train them. #VeteransDay

To every veteran: thank you. We are in awe of the courage and sacrifice you and your families display in service to our nation. And we must renew our commitment to caring for and honoring all who served. Happy #VeteransDay!

Making heath care more affordable and accessible saves lives. When I was Governor, we expanded coverage to 400,000 Coloradans‚Äîworking with Democrats and Republicans! In the Senate, I'll fight to make sure health care is a right, not a privilege.

Our leaders must be committed to public lands and outdoor recreation projects, like the fantastic Palisade Plunge in Mesa County which will be done soon. In Washington, I'll always fight to keep public lands in public hands.

Today, Donald Trump is headlining a big fundraiser for Sen. Cory Gardner‚Äîthey're calling it "Save the Senate." Republicans are pulling out all the stops to keep Mitch McConnell in power, but we can defeat them next year with your help. Chip in today: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/hickenlooperforco-soc?refcode=fb_191108

Today, we celebrate 126 years of women voting in Colorado! CO was the first state to give women the right to vote by popular referendum. But women of color weren't included then, and we still have a long way to go to make sure every voice is heard in our democracy. And check out this great video by #HerColorado! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ze2h6qMK5QM

Denver‚Äôs world-class music scene didn‚Äôt happen by accident. It took civic leaders, musicians, and artists coming together to grow the industry into what it is today. Thank you Chuck Morris for the super cool plaque. #tbt

Our public lands are what make Colorado so spectacular. That's why every U.S. Senator from our state for the last 50 years has introduced new wilderness legislation‚Äîuntil Sen. Cory Gardner. Urge him to change that and support the CORE Act.

After last night's historic election results, I am more fired up than ever to  organize, mobilize, and win in 2020 so we can put fighting climate change & fixing health care back at the top of the Senate's agenda.   We can do this, together. Join us!
Skye wants to remind you that you have just over an hour to get your ballot in! Voting locations close at 7:00pm. GoVoteColorado.com
We have same-day voter registration in Colorado. If you aren't registered, you can do so today when you go to vote! Find your voting location at GoVoteColorado.com.
Today is the day, Colorado. Get out and vote by 7pm tonight! Find where to vote or drop off your ballot at GoVoteColorado.com.

If you haven‚Äôt mailed in your ballot for tomorrow's election‚Äîthere's still time to vote! I took my ballot to a drop off location in Denver this morning. Head to govotecolorado.com to find out where you can make your voice heard.
White supremacy and anti-Semitism have no place in Colorado or anywhere in our country. I'm so grateful for the law enforcement officers who put a stop to this hateful attack.

Donald Trump raised $100,000 for Cory Gardner last week for having "his back on impeachment." I'm running for Senate to be an independent voice who'll work to move our country forward. One year from today, we will replace Sen. Gardner. Be a part of it:

We're one year out from Election Day 2020! Our campaign is only 10 weeks old, but so far I've seen that Coloradans want a senator who can bring people together and get things done. I'm looking forward to spending the next year going to every one of our 64 counties and earning your vote.
Open enrollment has begun! Coloradans, if you need health insurance, visit connectforhealthco.com to find a plan that works for you and your family. #GetCovered today.

Election Day is in just 3 days! You have your plan to vote, right? Drop your ballot off at a vote center or drop-box in your county (it is too late to mail it in). And you can register in person through Election Day in Colorado! #BeAVoter
Saturday is Denver's Night at the Museums! Many of Denver's museums will be free of charge to visit on Saturday night. Check it out:
And the winner is... Yoda! Skye is ready for trick-or-treaters‚Äîespecially all the treats. Have a happy and safe Halloween!

"President Donald Trump is rewarding senators who have his back on impeachment." Guess who's on the top of his list? Yep‚ÄîCory Gardner. This is scary, even for Halloween. Help us fight back: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/hickenlooperforco-soc?refcode=tw_20191031

Good news! The #COREAct now goes on to the Senate. Cory Gardner will you buck Donald Trump and stand with the majority of Coloradans, outdoor rec groups, sportsmen, veterans, conservationists, and businesses in supporting public lands?
A new public poll shows overwhelming support for the CORE Act among voters on the Western Slope. But Cory Gardner would rather stand with Trump than Coloradans.

We're putting some fun in fundraising and letting you pick Skye's Halloween costume. She'll sport whichever one gets the most donations by midnight tonight! üåÆTaco: https://bit.ly/2PvBpo5 ü¶àShark: https://bit.ly/2JziC7s üëΩYoda: https://bit.ly/3342YZG Yes‚Äîwe will post photos!

While you're hopefully staying warm and safe inside today, please take a few minutes to check your voter registration & make a plan to vote or drop off your ballot‚Äîif you haven't already. Election Day is Nov. 5th!

Will Senator Cory Gardner stand up to Donald Trump to protect our public lands? Doubtful. The CORE Act has wide bipartisan support, will strengthen our outdoor recreation economy & protect public lands. #COPolitics

"If he is not willing to defend the Constitution, Gardner should collect what honor remains to him and depart Washington, the sooner the better." Let's get Washington back on track. Support our campaign: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/hickenlooperforco-soc?refcode=fb_20191029
What a nice piece recognizing my friend Mannie Rodriguez by Lynn Bartels. I've been inspired by Mannie's dedication to Colorado for years. He's made this state a better place for all of us.

When Cory Gardner plays political games with our health care, we take the hit. This lawsuit is a prime example. If it's successful, hundreds of thousands of Coloradans could lose their insurance and costs could skyrocket. We need quality and affordable care.
Robin and I had a great time celebrating #Diwali with dear friends. Happy Diwali to all who celebrate the festival of lights!

One of my proudest accomplishments as Mayor was completing the Mercy Housing Aromor Apartments. After 10 years, we can officially call it a great success. Thank you to the staff, residents, and everyone who has contributed to this community. What a moving celebration last week.

A packed house today for the Denver Democrats‚Äô forum. We focused on combatting climate change. I appreciated the chance to talk about my plans for a renewable energy economy with net-zero emissions by 2050, and I‚Äôll fight for that every day in the Senate.‚Ä¨

Senator Cory Gardner is the first Colorado Senator of either party in over 50 years not to sponsor legislation to expand the state‚Äôs wilderness areas, but today he can change that. I'm challenging him to support the CORE Act. Join me and add your name:

Today, I'm announcing my support for the Colorado Outdoor Recreation & Economy Act and calling on Senator Cory Gardner to finally do the same. The CORE Act would: ‚úÖStrengthen CO's outdoor economy ‚úÖProtect 400,000 acres of public land including designating 73,000 new wilderness acres across CO We need a Senator who will stand up for public lands. If you agree Sen. Gardner should pass this important bill, join me:

So great to talk to Preet Bharara last night at a live taping of Stay Tuned about how I'll do everything I can to make sure Mitch McConnell is no longer Majority Leader, our favorite Kurt Vonnegut quotes, and more. Take a listen when it drops!

This is a serious mistake. Climate change is the defining threat and challenge of our time and we need to be working together to combat it. From day one as your Senator, I'll fight to rejoin and go beyond the Paris Climate Accord.

source: John W. Hickenlooper,Michael Franti and Spearhead
text: Sending LOVE to all of the Colorado Soulrockers for coming out for the Stay Human Harvest Ball!!! It was an epic celebration of optimism and community with music, advocacy, play, friends and family! BIG THANKS to our friends from New Belgium Brewing, REBBL, Alterra Mountain Company , Burton , Pact Organic, JadeYoga, Patagonia, Clif Bar, Aspen Snowmass and Do It For The Love for collaborating to make this happen ‚Äï to Devon Gilfillian & Bombargo for rockin‚Äô it at the Mission Ballroom ‚Äï AND to @Chris Davenport, Rob Schuham and John Hickenlooper for lending your voice to spread actionable awareness and solutions to climate change. Stay tuned for more celebrations coming soon to a city near you!!! michaelfranti.com  Video: The Public Works
Helping people and growing local economies are not partisan issues. How we've diversified the economy in Grand Junction should be a national model, and I'll bring that experience to the Senate.
Thank you Michael Franti, Chris Davenport and Rob Schuham for having me to discuss climate change and how we can work together to protect our planet.

I am proud to have helped expand access to contraception in Colorado, and in the Senate I will support programs that expand access to affordable and quality contraception on the federal level. Women should have control over their own bodies.

"John Hickenlooper...sent a strong message to Gardner when it comes to campaign financing, saying he wants to end the prevalence of 'dark money' in politics." Yes I do. I'll make decisions based on what's best for citizens, not special interests. https://www.montrosepress.com/news/hickenlooper-romanoff-among-democratic-candidates-for-u-s-senate-to/article_2b0d142c-f475-11e9-b590-6f46e3e73055.html

The lawsuit that could take health care away from nearly 800,000 Coloradans with pre-existing conditions could be heard as soon as this month. In the Senate, I‚Äôll always fight to protect health care.

The outdoor economy is vital to the Grand Junction region and our state. Thank you the Outdoor Recreation Coalition for giving me a tour of the Grand Junction Riverfront this morning. I'm looking forward to continuing to work together to protect our planet & way of life and grow our economy.

I was honored to speak at the Colorado Black Round Table forum yesterday. Far too many people in America and Colorado are disenfranchised because of the color of their skin. We must keep fighting for justice and equity. Thank you for the opportunity to listen, learn and join you.

It was a pleasure to be at the Colorado Democratic Latino Initiative meeting this morning. I will continue to fight to level the playing field and provide greater opportunity for Latinos in Colorado. Our state and country are strong because of your contributions.

This year on National Coming Out Day, standing up for our LGBTQ+ friends and neighbors is more important than ever. We're facing a Supreme Court case that could let employers fire people because of who they are. That's totally unacceptable. I'll always have your back.

Families shouldn‚Äôt have to choose between paying the rent and paying for prescription medications they need to survive. There‚Äôs no reason this should be happening. We need to lower the cost of Rx drugs, but politicians like Cory Gardner and Mitch McConnell are standing in the way.  https://www.politico.com/story/2019/09/19/mcconnell-pelosi-prescription-plan-1504496

We need a leader who will address the unique opportunities rural communities bring to the table and build and address distinctive challenges at the local level. A one-size-fits-all approach doesn‚Äôt work. Rural Americans deserve better.

Donald Trump's recent tariffs are thoughtless, and his reckless decisions will have lasting consequences for rural America. This is no way for a president to be running our economy. #TariffWarsAreForLosers

Trump's immigration policy is immoral, ineffective, and un-American.  As Governor of Colorado, I worked to fight the Trump Administration's efforts by signing historic legislation to grant undocumented immigrants tuition assistance and drivers' licenses.  As President, I will continue to fight for sensible immigration reform by leading efforts to protect the Dreamers and reversing Trump's efforts to prevent refugees from receiving asylum in the U.S.

In the late 1980s, I was laid off along with thousands of other geologists in a market shift. I lost not only my job but my profession.  After two years, some friends and I scrapped together the money to start a brewpub ‚Äî in an abandoned warehouse district of Denver.  Our business took off, and the whole neighborhood turned around with it.  But in today‚Äôs environment, with so many mega-players, I don‚Äôt know if my business ever could have gotten off the ground in the first place.  American capitalism must be reformed, but we will not solve our problems by endlessly expanding government and demonizing the private sector.  If we want to tackle America‚Äôs greatest challenges, we need to find a way to work together.

Justice must be different. The policies we pursue to ensure safety and fairness for our citizens need to be applied equally ‚Äî and people need to feel they are being applied equally ‚Äî if we are to bring Americans together again.

Today in Colorado:  We have near universal health care. All 64 counties have access to reliable broadband service. We've had the number one economy in the country for three consecutive years. We have the strictest methane emissions regulations in the country -- paid for by the oil & gas industry. We beat the NRA and passed universal background checks and magazine limits -- in a purple state.  We didn't just have big ideas. We made them happen.   This is my record, and it's my promise as president.
